HelpEntry.Text: The name of the Mob that will appear above their head
Used to indicate the role of the mob, appears under the name of the mob.
The prefab of the mob that will be used in the world.v Should contain a model and a MobController script.
The species of the mob. An ability can be set to only work on some species.
For cosmetic purposes only. This can be referenced in the UI.
Determines how the mob is displayed in the world. Untargetable is used for mobs that have no interaction.
What faction the mob belongs to. This will influence how the mob reacts to players and other mobs.
The scale/size of the mob. A scale of 1 will display the mob at the same size as the prefab.
How many metres away the mob can be hit from.
How fast, in metres per second, the mob walks. The mob walks when roaming and patrolling.
How fast, in metres per second, the mob runs. The mob runs when in combat.
What item is in the mob's Main Hand. This will increase the damage to mob deals.
What item is in the mob's Off Hand. If it is a weapon the mob will begin dual-wielding
What state of idle animation the mob will play by default.
The combat level of the mob. This will influence the strength of the mob in combat
The base amount of damage the mob deals. This is not the final damage amount.
Can the mob be attacked.
How fast in seconds the mob performs Auto-Attacks.
The type of damage the mob deals with their Auto-Attack.
Used to allow a group of mobs to be set as a target for a Quest Objective.
